Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module A
Section 1: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, Including Immunizations

Routine Schedule for Cleaning, Sanitizing, & Disinfecting

Select each flashcard to read more about some general schedule guidelines for cleaning, sanitizing, and disinfecting. 

Food Area

Food areas should be cleaned and sanitized before and after each use, and at the end of the day. Use a sanitizer safe for food.

Child Care Area

Food areas should be cleaned and sanitized before and after each use, and at the end of the day. Use a sanitizer safe for food.

Toileting & Diapering Area

Toileting and diapering areas should be cleaned and sanitized at the end of the day. In addition, potty chairs and changing tables should be cleaned and sanitized after each use. LARA requires these areas to be sanitized. However, best practices from Caring for Our Children recommends disinfecting.

Sleeping Area

Sleeping areas should be cleaned once a week. Also, they should be cleaned before use by another child.

A detailed cleaning schedule can be found in the link at the end of this section under Caring for Our Children, Appendix K.
